comment: I enjoyed Professor Benedict's class—it was discussion-based and engaging. No textbook was needed, just access to children's stories. Most of the work was reading responses, plus a midterm and final essay. I loved that she gave essay extensions, but sometimes she didn't post reading assignments or respond to emails. Still, the class was rewarding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Love her she's wonderful! Very class discussion based and she encourages participation but the topics are really interesting and I genuinely left with take aways from the course. The workload did get a bit annoying at times but its very consistent and manageable. I was able to miss a few in-class assignments and do fine but I recommend attendance!!

Dr. Benedict is an understanding professor, and although it was a heavy workload, I never felt overwhelmed by the class. She gave many extra credit opportunities throughout the semester and offered revisions for each major assignment. Our final project was super creative and fun, not a paper. It's an easy A by doing the work and discussion posts.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: This is my second class I've taken with Dr. B, and I love her to death. She is kind and genuinely cares. This class focuses on children's literature, but it is very interesting. She wants students involved. There is a lot of reading (whole books in a week), but they're easy reads because they're meant for children.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: BEWARE, you have to buy/rent a lot of things. Movies, books, documentaries. There is A LOT of work. 500 discussion post plus 2 comments of 250 word count. You have to read/watch material for the quizzes, they are about 6 questions max. I did enjoy the class material though, very interesting and thought provoking so the post were not too hard.

Dr.Benedict was a great person, easy grader, but BEWARE of the amount of work for an online literature class. As long as you do the assignments and meet the word count and arent copying/using AI/plagiarizing you will get an A, but it takes a looong time and lots of reading. Probably 8ish hours a week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I was legitmately surprise by the amount of work for a 2000-level course. You will ALWAYS have some kind of homework or readings to do, even during breaks or when she cancels class. I found the coursework and topics covered very confusing and felt lost during a majority of the lectures. Just a bit too conceptual for me. Prof Benedict is sweet tho!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I don't know if I should call this class easy or hard. I got an A, and the class was fun, but I have also never had to do so much research and reading. I didn't know I'd be looking up ancient forms of pest control or writing like a mad scientist from the 1800s. If you like weird ideas and internet rabbit holes, I greatly recommend her classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: She is very nice and welcoming. The class is mostly discussion posts, replies, and weekly quizzes. The required books can be found online and you can pass the quizzes by just skimming the chapters. Benedict is good if you want an easy class but she will make you read a lot. The final paper wasn't too much, did it in
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Weekly discussion posts and readings from required books you can get off amazon for super cheap. rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: She's very sweet and enjoys teaching. Her lecture style was nice, but we did a lot of in class work so show up to classes. Easy stuff tho, just do it. comment: All the books can be found free online. I forgot to read sometimes and just winged it. You have to actually go to most of the classes because thats where most of your grade comes from. comment: Professor Benedict is one of the best professors I've ever had.
